snippet: In announcing the closing, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg cited damage to school buildings as the reason, but said he expected almost all schools to reopen Monday.
abstract: New York City public schools will remain closed through the week in the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy, the longest suspension of school in at least 30 years; Mayor Bloomberg acknowleding the enormous scheduling headache for parents throughout the city, but says closure is necessary due to structural damage from the storm coupled with power losses.
lead_paragraph: In announcing the closing, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg cited damage to school buildings as the reason, but said he expected almost all schools to reopen Monday.

headline.seo: New York City Schools Shut for the Week
headline.main: Storm Closes City Schools for a Week
headline.print_headline: Storm Closes City Schools for a Week, the System’s Longest Suspension in Decades
